description: Conversion of residential building comprising of ten flats into eight self-contained residential units, extension of existing basement level with the provision of lightwells to the front, rear and side; part single, two storey rear extensions, roof extension to main rear roof slope (following demolition of existing roof extension), and associated landscaping and provisions for refuse, cycle storage; formation of vehicular crossover and creation of off-street parking space
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the above drawings and documents.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No part of the roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Refuse and recycling storage areas, providing a minimum of one (1) 1100L refuse bin and one (1) 1100L recycling bin, shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans listed under condition 2 and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse storage in accordance with policies SI 7 and SI 8 of the London Plan (2021). | The proposed development shall achieve an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, living room/kitchen above bedrooms of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. The measures shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policy 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10. | The proposed cycle parking shall be delivered in accordance with ref: 557_03_104 rev C.
The enclosures shall be located and built to specifications of the approved details and shall brought into use prior to the occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and the policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, details of the hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development. The details shall include:
a. The layout of the forecourt and rear gardens;
b. The species of planting to be used throughout the development, including planting around the lightwells and to the front boundary;
c. The details of the materials and height of fencing around rear lightwells;
d. A maintenance plan for all planting; and
e. The height, siting and materials of the gates to the ground floor flats.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained on site for the lifetime of the development.

Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening, to ensure the privacy of future occupiers is not compromised and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies D3, D4, D6, G4, and G5 of the London Plan (2021); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 3.5, 5.10, 7B, 7D and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The demolition and construction activities shall be delivered in accordance with ref: PCT0581/001 (Patterson Construction)

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy D14 and T7 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD.
